meanings.definition: The act of making strategic plays at the end of a game or performance.
meanings.sent1: In the final moments of the match, the team's endplays determined the winner.
meanings.sent2: The endplays in the last scene of the play were crucial for the actors.
meanings.sent3: The endplays at the end of the concert had the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: Her endplays in the chess game were like a master's final move.
meanings.sent5: The endplays in the closing minutes were a brilliant display of skill and strategy.

meanings.definition: A series of plays or maneuvers made towards the end of a game or performance.
meanings.sent1: The coach's endplays in the final quarter turned the game around.
meanings.sent2: The endplays in the last act of the play added excitement to the performance.
meanings.sent3: The endplays at the end of the play were unexpected and entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His endplays on the stage were like a dancer's graceful finale.
meanings.sent5: The endplays in the closing moments left the audience in awe.
